posts.title: Free Shopping Appointments Available For Native Trees and Plants
posts.content:
Dreaming of Spring? The Dr. Compton Native Tree & Plant Sale is happening March 28 - April 1, and you can save your spot today.

  • Native gardens: Save your spot now to shop for the most beautiful Arkansas native trees and plants for your home and garden. There will be over 50 varieties available and you can see the full list of plants here.
  • More to learn: Want to learn more about native plants? Sign up for a program at Compton Gardens & Arboretum, available every Saturday in March.

Compton Gardens & Arboretum is a community space provided by Peel Compton Foundation. Learn more at peelcompton.org.

posts.title: Kayak Company Plans For Distribution Center In NWA
posts.content:
As the scene for outdoor sports and activities continues to grow in Northwest Arkansas, the region is alluring to some big outdoor manufacturers. Most recently, 50-year-old company Eddyline Kayaks announced plans to make the move. 

  • Funding: With a minority growth investment from a Bentonville investment fund, Eddyline has plans for a distribution center here in NWA sometime this calendar year, which will be a stepping stone for future dealers in the area. 
  • Marketplace: Eddyline manufactures some of the highest quality lightweight kayaks all from its headquarters in Washington. With 150 store locations, the closest one to NWA is currently in Kansas. By moving to NWA, it will allow Eddyline "to support the distribution needs of our existing and future dealer partners".

For more information, click HERE.

posts.title: Regional Events Planned For Black History Month
posts.content:
February is Black History Month and there are events scheduled around the region to commemorate the occasion. 

  • Art: In Rogers, the February theme for Art on the Bricks Art Walk is Reflections of the Black Experience. The exhibition will begin on Feb. 6 with an opening reception at INTO+VIEW Art Gallery and Studios. 
  • Conversations: In Fayetteville, the Black Action Collective has a series of events planned starting tonight with a virtual evening to reflect on a moment in history starting at 6:30p. Throughout the month there will be a reading of Letter From Birmingham Jail, a racial equity training, a collective expo, and more.

Check out more events happening in the region with the Fayetteville Flyer’s guide HERE.

posts.title: Walmart Partnership Results In Online Health Portal
posts.content:
With convenient and individualized care growing in demand, Walmart Inc. and Quest Diagnostics partnered to create a solution. 

  • Online health: Walmart and Quest have created a website where consumers can receive more than 50 diagnostic tests including Covid-19 and allergies exams. Individuals can shop privately and tests can be ordered by a physician if required.
  • Self-help: This new broad access to healthcare services expands Walmart’s commitment to individualize and personalize the healthcare experience for its customers. Individuals can now shop and schedule appointments often available the same day.

For more details about the new partnership, click HERE.

posts.title: Public Invited To Witness Barred Owl Return To Wild
posts.content:
Would you like to see nature take back one of its own? Well, the public is invited to participate in the release of a rehabilitated Barred Owl this Saturday from 4-5p. 

  • Experiential education: The Botanical Garden of the Ozarks is hosting the release by Northsong Wild Bird Rehabilitation. The public is invited to attend to learn about Northsong, the Barred Owl, and to witness the release. 
  • Healed: The animal was partially blind and had a broken leg when it was presented to Northsong back in early October. The owl’s leg was surgically repaired and now he can fly and hunt, ready to return to the wild. 

The event is free, though RSVPs are requested. RSVP HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Local quality: Know your meat was raised in green rolling pastures by shopping with Eat Local Beef.*
  • Captured: Check out some photos from the UCI Cyclo-Cross World Championship: Gallery 1, 2, 3, 4.
  • Winter weather: Catch up on the latest forecast before you leave home this morning - it may get slippery.
  • Local history: Fayetteville is mentioned in a 20th-century travel guide as a safe, inclusive place.
  • Sing and dance: Two more iconic bands have made the line-up for this year's Walmart AMP concert series.
  • Need a story told? We got you. Email us with an advertisement inquiry or check out our options here.
